Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention provides methods of designing and making structurally stabilized anti-microbial peptides for the prophylaxis and treatment of infection. Methods are also disclosed for designing stabilized anti-microbial peptides that are selectively lytic/cytotoxic to bacteria, allowing for internal use of anti-microbial peptides without mammalian membrane disruption and cytotoxicity.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: M-lycotoxin-Hc2a (M-LCTX-Hc2a; Lycotoxin-2; Lycotoxin II; spiders, Arthropods, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus thuringiensis subsp. Israelensis (MIC=10-60 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli D31 (MIC<10 µM), Escherichia coli DH5 (MIC<40 µM).Fungi:Candida glabrata ATCC 2001 (MIC=100-150 µM)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Forms pore that permeabilize the cell membrane. Promotes efflux of calcium from synaptosomes, causes hemolysis, and dissipates voltage gradients across muscle membrane. Potently inhibits the growth of bacteria, yeast and Leishmania. May Function

Literature.Title: Lycotoxins, antimicrobial peptides from venom of the wolf spider Lycosa carolinensis.
Literature.Author: Yan L, Adams ME.

Literature.Title: Membrane structure and interactions of a short Lycotoxin I analogue.
Literature.Author: Adão R, Seixas R, Gomes P, Pessoa JC, Bastos M.
